channel.title: More hosting issues >:|
channel.description:
Alright so this has happened to me with every computer ive had. Im using belkin54g wireless thingy and i type in my ip adress in that bar i get to the page i go to virtual servers... i click submit(because i dont have a password) and it says login error. right now im starting to think its my belking and my modem I have used windows xp on all my computers because thats all i have
Is there a way to get past this? because i really need to portforward this shit

item.title: More hosting issues >:|
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

have you tried to google about your router specifically? If so try portforward.com because they have more info on routers then just port5 forwarding

Read full topic

item.title: More hosting issues >:|
item.dc:creator: @JavaProgrammer JavaProgrammer
item.description:
@JavaProgrammer wrote:

lol…im using my default! i use regular ip adress and 192.188..

you wont get those numbers

Read full topic

item.title: More hosting issues >:|
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:3, topic:414009”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=515971.msg3743328#msg3743328 date=1315539805]
Not server help. But XP should not be the problem. I use XP with Linksys router and it works fine… And linksys is a hardcoded router. If you are typing in your IP adress you wont get anywhere… You need to go to Start->Run->Type “CMD”->Type “ipconfig” and look for your default gateway
[/quote]
He can’t login to his router, lol.[/quote]Exactly, he said he is using his IP adress when he should be using the Default Gateway Adress…

Read full topic

item.title: More hosting issues >:|
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Not server help. But XP should not be the problem. I use XP with Linksys router and it works fine… And linksys is a hardcoded router. If you are typing in your IP adress you wont get anywhere… You need to go to Start->Run->Type “CMD”->Type “ipconfig” and look for your default gateway

He can’t login to his router, lol.

Read full topic
